Tiramisu
Based on the original Tiramisu recipe from Le Beccherie Restaurant, but with reduced sugar as it turns out way too sweet
12g coffee powder
660ml water
12 egg yolks
220g sugar
1kg mascarpone
60 ladyfinger biscuits
Cocoa powder
  1. Before starting, determine your scaling by calculating how many ladyfingers you need to create a complete layer in your dish. Decide whether you want 2 or 3 layers of ladyfingers. Ensure there are no gaps in the layers. Note that soaked ladyfingers expand slightly, so perform a dry fit beforehand and add about 10% more to account for this
  2. Make the coffee and leave it to cool
  3. Whip the egg yolks with the sugar until pale and thick (see video )
  4. Add in mascarpone and beat until it reaches firm peaks stage (see video ). Start at low speed, moving up to medium, and expect this to take quite a few minutes. If you overbeat, it will eventually curdle, but don't be scared
  5. Dunk the ladyfingers in the coffee. You should use it all, and each finger should get the same amountx
  6. Spread half of the mascarpone cream evenly over the ladyfingers
  7. Create another layer using the remaining 30 coffee-dipped ladyfingers, then spread the remaining mascarpone cream on top
  8. Sift cocoa powder generously over the mascarpone layer
  9. Store in the fridge until ready to serve, ideally 8 to hours
Notes
  • Coffee volume is an estimate, increased 20% from the previous effort (9g per ladyfinger) which left the biscuits slightly too dry
Original recipe by Le Beccherie Restaurant
